channel.title: JaneBytes Cybersecurity Feed
channel.description: Summarized articles from top cybersecurity sources.

item.title: FireWood Malware Targets Linux Systems for Command Execution and Data Theft
item.description: Vulnerable Product: FireWood backdoor; CVE(s): None; Summary: The article describes a new variant of the FireWood Linux-based remote access trojan (RAT), which deploys kernel-level rootkit modules, enables attackers to execute arbitrary commands, exfiltrates sensitive data, and maintains long-term persistence. The new variant retains core functionalities but introduces refinements in implementation and configuration, enhancing its evasion and operational efficiency without altering the fundamental protocol.

item.title: Have You Turned Off Your Virtual Oven?
item.description: The article discusses the importance of External Attack Surface Management (EASM) and Digital Risk Protection (DRP) in monitoring and securing an organization's internet-facing assets. It highlights the challenges of manually verifying asset exposure and the benefits of using automated tools to detect and prevent security incidents.

item.title: New Android Malware Wave Hits Banking via NFC Relay Fraud, Call Hijacking, and Root Exploits
item.description: Vulnerable Product: Go1ano developer; CVE(s): None; Summary: The PhantomCard Android trojan abuses NFC to conduct relay attacks, facilitating fraudulent transactions targeting banking customers in Brazil. It requests victims to place their credit/debit card on the back of their phone and then relays the card data to an attacker-controlled NFC relay server, allowing the cybercriminal to use the victim's card as if it was in their hands.

item.title: Leak: OpenAI's browser will use ChatGPT Agent to control the browser
item.description: This article is not about a vulnerability. It discusses OpenAI's upcoming Chromium-based browser and the integration of its AI agent technology, ChatGPT, into the new browser. The article also mentions password cracking trends in a separate report.

item.title: Splunk Publishes Defender’s Guide to Spot ESXi Ransomware Early
item.description: The article discusses a comprehensive defender's guide released by Splunk to help cybersecurity teams detect and prevent ransomware attacks targeting ESXi infrastructure. The guide provides instructions for ingesting ESXi logs into the Splunk security platform, as well as analysis of different log types and detection rules targeting common attack behaviors.

item.title: EncryptHub Turns Brave Support Into a Dropper; MMC Flaw Completes the Run
item.description: Vulnerable Product: Microsoft Management Console (MMC); CVE(s): CVE-2025-26633; Summary: The vulnerability, CVE-2025-26633, enables attackers to execute arbitrary code via manipulated .msc files, allowing EncryptHub to infiltrate systems through a blend of social engineering and technical exploitation.

item.title: Windows Out-of-Box-Experience Flaw Enables Full Administrative Command Prompt Access
item.description: Vulnerable Product: Microsoft Windows; CVE(s): None; Summary: A vulnerability in Windows' Out-of-Box-Experience (OOBE) allows users to bypass security restrictions and gain full administrative access to command prompt functionality, even when Microsoft's intended protective measures are in place. The vulnerability enables users to spawn an elevated command shell with administrative privileges through the defaultuser0 account, which maintains membership in the local Administrators group during the initial setup process.

item.title: ‘AI Induced Destruction’ – How AI Misuse is Creating New Attack Vectors
item.description: Vulnerable Product: None; Summary: The article discusses a new trend in 2025 where artificial intelligence (AI) assistants designed to boost productivity are inadvertently causing massive system failures and data breaches due to excessive permissions and vague instructions from developers. The incidents involve AI systems misinterpreting ambiguous commands and executing destructive actions with the best intentions, often taking the most efficient but destructive path to completion.

item.title: A Mega Malware Analysis Tutorial Featuring Donut-Generated Shellcode
item.description: The article is a step-by-step malware analysis tutorial featuring shellcode generated by Donut. The tutorial walks through a single infection chain, starting with a sample, and assuming no prior knowledge of the malware in question. It highlights various techniques used by malware, such as dynamic API resolution, process injection, and bypassing AMSI by using memory patching.

item.title: Attackers Need Just One Vulnerability to Own Your Rooted Android
item.description: Vulnerable Product: KernelSU; CVE(s): CVE-2023-0000; Summary: The vulnerability in KernelSU version 0.5.7 allows attackers to impersonate the legitimate manager app, enabling full device compromise. The flaw arises from a race condition in the kernel's verification of the signing certificate, which can be exploited by manipulating file descriptor ordering and pre-authenticating with the crafted APK.

item.title: Simple Steps for Attack Surface Reduction
item.description: This article provides guidelines on setting default security policies to prevent attacks. It recommends configuring systems to block risks out of the gate, including enabling MFA, application whitelisting, disabling Office macros, and blocking SMBv1 and RDP ports. The article also suggests removing local admin rights, controlling application behaviors, securing VPNs, and limiting file access.

item.title: CISA warns of N-able N-central flaws exploited in zero-day attacks
item.description: Vulnerable Product: N-able N-central; CVE(s): CVE-2025-8875, CVE-2025-8876; Summary: The N-able N-central RMM platform has two security vulnerabilities that allow threat actors to gain command execution and inject commands via insecure deserialization and improper sanitization of user input. These flaws can be exploited to gain unauthorized access to networks and devices, and are actively being exploited in the wild.

item.title: Microsoft fixes Windows 11 24H2 updates failing with 0x80240069 error
item.description: Vulnerable Product: Microsoft Windows 11; CVE(s): None; Summary: The August 2025 Windows 11 24H2 cumulative update fails to install via Windows Server Update Services (WSUS) due to a known issue, resulting in error code 0x80240069 and unexpected termination of the Windows Update service. A fix is being rolled out through Known Issue Rollback (KIR), requiring administrators to install a group policy setting on affected devices.

item.title: Proxyware Campaign Piggybacks on Popular YouTube Video Download Services
item.description: This article discusses a proxyware distribution campaign by threat actors, exploiting unwitting users in South Korea to install unauthorized bandwidth-sharing tools like DigitalPulse and Honeygain. The malware disguises itself as legitimate YouTube video downloaders and utilizes GitHub repositories as a distribution vector.

item.title: Google Requires Crypto App Licenses in 15 Regions as FBI Warns of $9.9M Scam Losses
item.description: Google is implementing a new policy requiring developers of cryptocurrency exchanges and wallets to obtain government licenses before publishing apps in 15 jurisdictions, aiming to ensure a safe and compliant ecosystem for users. The policy applies to markets like Bahrain, Canada, Hong Kong, Indonesia, Israel, Japan, the Philippines, South Africa, South Korea, Switzerland, Thailand, the United Arab Emirates, the United Kingdom, the United States, and the European Union.

item.title: Xerox FreeFlow Core Vulnerability Allows Remote Code Execution — PoC Now Public
item.description: Vulnerable Product: Xerox; CVE(s): CVE-2025-8355, CVE-2025-8356; Summary: The Xerox FreeFlow Core has two severe vulnerabilities that allow unauthenticated remote attackers to execute arbitrary code on vulnerable systems. The first is an XML External Entity (XXE) injection flaw and the second is a path traversal vulnerability that enables uploading webshells to publicly accessible directories, providing immediate remote access to compromised systems.

item.title: Critical WordPress Plugin Vulnerability Puts 70,000+ Sites at Risk of Remote Code Execution
item.description: Vulnerable Product: Plugin "Databasefor Contact Form 7, WPforms, Elementor forms"; CVE(s): CVE-2025-7384; Summary: A critical vulnerability in the plugin allows unauthenticated attackers to inject malicious PHP objects, leading to potential complete website compromise. The combination with a Property-Oriented Programming (POP) chain enables arbitrary file deletion capabilities, including the removal of WordPress's core configuration file.

item.title: CISA Alerts on N-able N-Central Deserialization and Injection Flaw Under Active Exploitation
item.description: Vulnerable Product: N-able N-Central; CVE(s): CVE-2025-8875, CVE-2025-8876; Summary: The vulnerabilities involve an insecure deserialization flaw (CVE-2025-8875) that allows command execution and a command injection flaw (CVE-2025-8876) stemming from improper sanitization of user input. These flaws enable attackers to execute commands, compromise network infrastructures, and potentially gain unauthorized access to system resources and sensitive data.

item.title: CISA Adds Two N-able N-central Flaws to Known Exploited Vulnerabilities Catalog
item.description: Vulnerable Product: N-able N-central; CVE(s): CVE-2025-8875, CVE-2025-8876; Summary: An insecure deserialization vulnerability (CVE-2025-8875) and a command injection vulnerability via improper sanitization of user input (CVE-2025-8876) in N-able N-central's Remote Monitoring and Management (RMM) platform have been added to the Known Exploited Vulnerabilities (KEV) catalog, with evidence of active exploitation. Both vulnerabilities require authentication to exploit, but patching is recommended to secure the environment.

item.title: Google Gemini's Deep Research is finally coming to API
item.description:
Vulnerable Product: Google Gemini; CVE(s): None; Summary: Not a vulnerability, but the article mentions potential use cases of Deep Research in API, including integrating it into an IDE to prepare reports or plans, and autonomously searching the web for relevant information.
(Note: The article is not about a specific vulnerability, but rather discusses the capabilities and potential uses of Google Gemini's Deep Research feature.)

item.title: OpenAI relaxes GPT-5 rate limit, promises to improve the personality
item.description: Vulnerable Product: None; FYSA: The article discusses OpenAI's efforts to address concerns around its GPT-5 model, including restoring older models for paid customers and working on an update to GPT-5's personality. Additionally, the article mentions a statistic that 46% of environments had passwords cracked in 2025, nearly doubling from the previous year.

item.title: Fortinet warns of FortiSIEM pre-auth RCE flaw with exploit in the wild
item.description: Vulnerable Product: Fortinet FortiSIEM; CVE(s): CVE-2025-25256; Summary: A remote unauthenticated command injection flaw (CVE-2025-25256) exists in multiple branches of FortiSIEM, allowing an attacker to execute unauthorized code or commands via crafted CLI requests. The vulnerability is critical with a CVSS score of 9.8 and has functional exploit code available in the wild.

item.title: Infamous XZ Backdoor Found Hidden in Docker Images for Over a Year
item.description: Vulnerable Product: XZ Utils; CVE(s): None; Summary: The backdoor, attributed to a pseudonymous developer 'Jia Tan', was embedded in versions 5.6.0 and 5.6.1 of the lossless compression library. It targets liblzma.so, enabling unauthorized remote access through OpenSSH servers by tampering with control flow using GNU Indirect Function (IFUNC) resolvers.

item.title: ZDI-25-831: Delta Electronics DIAView Directory Traversal Information Disclosure Vulnerability
item.description: Vulnerable Product: Delta Electronics DIAView; CVE(s): CVE-2025-53417; Summary: The vulnerability allows remote attackers to disclose sensitive information without authentication. It occurs due to a lack of proper validation of user-supplied paths in file operations, which can be exploited to reveal information in the context of the service account.

item.title: ZDI-25-832: Delta Electronics DIAView Directory Traversal Remote Code Execution Vulnerability
item.description: Vulnerable Product: Delta Electronics DIAView; CVE(s): CVE-2025-53417; Summary: This vulnerability allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code on affected installations of Delta Electronics DIAView without authentication. The issue exists within the web service, which listens on TCP port 80 by default, due to a lack of proper validation of user-supplied paths in file operations.

item.title: ZDI-25-833: NVIDIA Transformers4Rec load_model_trainer_states_from_checkpoint Deserialization of Untrusted Data Remote Code Execution Vulnerability
item.description: Vulnerable Product: NVIDIA Transformers4Rec; CVE(s): CVE-2025-23266; Summary: This vulnerability allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code on affected installations of NVIDIA Transformers4Rec. User interaction is required to exploit this vulnerability, and the target must visit a malicious page or open a malicious file. The issue results from the lack of proper validation of user-supplied data, which can result in deserialization of untrusted data.

item.title: ZDI-25-834: Academy Software Foundation OpenEXR EXR File Parsing Heap-based Buffer Overflow Remote Code Execution Vulnerability
item.description: Vulnerable Product: Academy Software Foundation OpenEXR; CVE(s): CVE-2025-48071; Summary: This vulnerability allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code on affected installations of Academy Software Foundation OpenEXR. User interaction is required to exploit this vulnerability, as the target must visit a malicious page or open a malicious file. The issue results from the lack of proper validation of the length of user-supplied data prior to copying it to a heap-based buffer.

item.title: ZDI-25-835: NoMachine Uncontrolled Search Path Element Local Privilege Escalation Vulnerability
item.description: Vulnerable Product: NoMachine; CVE(s): CVE-2025-8614; Summary: This vulnerability allows local attackers to escalate privileges on affected installations of NoMachine, requiring an attacker to execute low-privileged code first. The specific flaw exists within the configuration of OpenSSL, which loads a configuration file from an unsecured location, allowing privilege escalation and arbitrary code execution in the context of the service account.

item.title: ZDI-25-836: Rockwell Automation Arena Simulation DOE File Parsing Out-Of-Bounds Write Remote Code Execution Vulnerability
item.description: Vulnerable Product: Rockwell Automation Arena Simulation; CVE(s): CVE-2025-6376; Summary: This vulnerability allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code on affected installations of Rockwell Automation Arena Simulation. User interaction is required to exploit this vulnerability, and the target must visit a malicious page or open a malicious file. The issue results from the lack of proper validation of user-supplied data, which can result in a write past the end of an allocated object.

item.title: ZDI-25-837: Rockwell Automation Arena Simulation DOE File Parsing Out-Of-Bounds Write Remote Code Execution Vulnerability
item.description: Vulnerable Product: Rockwell Automation Arena Simulation; CVE(s): CVE-2025-6377; Summary: This vulnerability allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code on affected installations of Rockwell Automation Arena Simulation. User interaction is required to exploit this vulnerability, and the specific flaw exists within the parsing of DOE files.

item.title: Emerging AI-Driven Phishing Trends Reshape Cybercrime Tactics
item.description: Artificial intelligence (AI) is revolutionizing phishing and scams, enabling the generation of hyper-realistic deceptive content that exploits current events and personal data. Cybercriminals are using neural networks, large language models, and deepfakes to craft flawless communications that mimic legitimate sources, targeting individuals and organizations with personalized attacks. This shift in tactics includes automated data harvesting, voice cloning, and synthetic audio and visual content, making it increasingly difficult for users to detect malicious links or attachments.

item.title: Windows 11 24H2 updates failing again with 0x80240069 errors
item.description: Vulnerable Product: Microsoft Windows 11; CVE(s): None; Summary: The KB5063878 Windows 11 24H2 cumulative update fails to install on some systems, resulting in error code 0x80240069 and messages indicating the Windows Update service has terminated unexpectedly. This issue affects only systems receiving updates through WSUS, primarily impacting enterprise environments.

item.title: New downgrade attack can bypass FIDO auth in Microsoft Entra ID
item.description: Vulnerable Product: Microsoft Entra ID; CVE(s): None; Summary: A new FIDO downgrade attack tricks users into authenticating with weaker login methods, making them susceptible to phishing and session hijacking. The attack employs a custom phishlet within the Evilginx adversary-in-the-middle framework to spoof an unsupported browser user agent, forcing users to choose alternate verification fallback methods that can be intercepted by attackers, resulting in stolen account credentials and MFA tokens or session cookies.

item.title: Google’s Android pKVM Framework Achieves SESIP Level 5 Certification
item.description: The article discusses the achievement of Google's protected KVM (pKVM) in achieving SESIP Level 5 certification, a major breakthrough for open-source security and consumer electronics. This milestone positions pKVM as the inaugural software security system tailored for widespread deployment in consumer devices to reach this elite assurance threshold.

item.title: Adobe’s August 2025 Patch Tuesday Fixes 60 Vulnerabilities Across Multiple Products
item.description: Vulnerable Product: Adobe; CVE(s): None; Summary: Adobe has rolled out August 2025 Patch Tuesday updates, addressing a total of 60 vulnerabilities across various products, including creative tools and enterprise solutions. The patches primarily focus on out-of-bounds read and write issues, use-after-free errors, and arbitrary code execution risks, many of which carry high severity ratings due to their potential for remote exploitation.

item.title: Spike in Fortinet VPN brute-force attacks raises zero-day concerns
item.description:
Vulnerable Product: Fortinet; CVE(s): None; Summary: The article reports a massive spike in brute-force attacks targeting Fortinet SSL VPNs and FortiManager, which is often seen as a precursor to new vulnerability disclosures. The campaign started with FortiOS SSL VPN endpoints and later shifted to FortiManager's FGFM profile, suggesting the same attackers or toolset/infrastructure were used.
FYSA:

item.title: Pennsylvania attorney general's email, site down after cyberattack
item.description: Vulnerable Product: Citrix NetScaler; CVE(s): CVE-2025-5777; Summary: Multiple public-facing Citrix NetScaler appliances on the Pennsylvania Attorney General's network were found to be vulnerable to attacks exploiting a critical vulnerability tracked as CVE-2025-5777 (Citrix Bleed 2).

item.title: 10 Best Purple Teaming Companies in 2025
item.description:
The provided article highlights eight companies that specialize in Purple Teaming, a collaborative approach to cybersecurity that simulates real-world cyber attacks on an organization's digital assets to identify and address vulnerabilities. These companies are Deloitte, QualySec, Redscan, SCYTHE, and others, offering comprehensive services including penetration testing, red teaming, and incident response.
While the article does not specifically discuss a vulnerability (software, hardware, or firmware), it provides valuable insights into the importance of aligning defense and offense in cybersecurity. The highlighted companies demonstrate unique strengths in providing tailored Purple Teaming services that can help organizations achieve robust cybersecurity resilience.

item.title: SmartLoader Malware Masquerades as Legitimate GitHub Repository to Infect Users
item.description: This article describes a sophisticated campaign involving the dissemination of SmartLoader malware through GitHub repositories designed to mimic legitimate software projects. The malware targets users searching for illicit content and exploits trust in GitHub's ecosystem, ultimately leading to the installation of payloads such as infostealers like Rhadamanthys, Redline, and Lumma Stealer.

item.title: New PS1Bot Malware Campaign Uses Malvertising to Deploy Multi-Stage In-Memory Attacks
item.description: No vulnerability is discussed in the article. Instead, it describes a new malvertising campaign that distributes a multi-stage malware framework called PS1Bot, which features modules for information theft, keylogging, reconnaissance, and persistent system access. The campaign uses malvertising as a propagation vector and has been active since early 2025.

item.title: ZDI-25-744: (Pwn2Own) QNAP TS-464 reset_password.cgi Improper Certificate Validation Authentication Bypass Vulnerability
item.description: Vulnerable Product: QNAP TS-464; CVE(s): ZDI-25-744, ZDI-CAN-25483; Summary: This vulnerability allows network-adjacent attackers to bypass authentication on affected installations of QNAP TS-464 devices without requiring authentication. The issue exists within the reset_password.cgi endpoint due to improper certificate validation, allowing attackers to exploit this vulnerability.

item.title: Hackers Deploy Dedicated Phishlet for FIDO Authentication Downgrade Attacks
item.description: Vulnerable Product: N/A; CVE(s): None; Summary: A novel technique allows threat actors to bypass FIDO-based authentication through downgrade attacks, leveraging a custom phishlet within adversary-in-the-middle (AiTM) frameworks. The attack exploits gaps in browser compatibility and user agent handling, forcing victims to revert to less secure MFA mechanisms, enabling credential theft and session hijacking.

item.title: SOCRadar on 2025 Inc. 5000 List of America’s Fastest-Growing Companies
item.description: SOCRadar, a cybersecurity company, has been ranked No. 169 on the 2025 Inc. 5000 list of America's fastest-growing private companies, with 2,301% three-year growth. This recognition highlights the company's rapid revenue growth, customer trust, and team dedication.

item.title: ZDI-25-652: (Pwn2Own) Microsoft SharePoint ToolPane Authentication Bypass Vulnerability
item.description: Vulnerable Product: Microsoft SharePoint; CVE(s): CVE-2025-53771; Summary: This vulnerability allows remote attackers to bypass authentication on affected installations of Microsoft SharePoint, allowing unauthorized access. Authentication is not required to exploit this vulnerability, which exists within the ToolPane endpoint due to inadequate restrictions on a protected API.

item.title: ZDI-25-653: (Pwn2Own) Microsoft SharePoint Deserialization of Untrusted Data Remote Code Execution Vulnerability
item.description: Vulnerable Product: Microsoft SharePoint; CVE(s): CVE-2025-53770; Summary: The vulnerability allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code on affected installations of Microsoft SharePoint Server, bypassing existing authentication mechanisms. The issue stems from the lack of proper validation of user-supplied data, leading to deserialization of untrusted data and potential code execution in the context of the SharePoint web server process.

item.title: ZDI-25-654: SolarWinds TFTP Server Deserialization of Untrusted Data Local Privilege Escalation Vulnerability
item.description: Vulnerable Product: SolarWinds TFTP Server; CVE(s): CVE-2025-26397; Summary: This vulnerability allows local attackers to escalate privileges on affected installations of SolarWinds TFTP Server by deserializing untrusted data. An attacker must first obtain the ability to execute low-privileged code on the target system and can leverage this vulnerability to escalate privileges and execute arbitrary code in the context of SYSTEM.

item.title: ZDI-25-655: Samsung MagicINFO 9 Server downloadChangedFiles Directory Traversal Authentication Bypass Vulnerability
item.description: Vulnerable Product: Samsung MagicINFO 9 Server; CVE(s): CVE-2025-54438; Summary: This vulnerability allows remote attackers to bypass authentication on affected installations of Samsung MagicINFO 9 Server, without requiring authentication. The flaw exists in the downloadChangedFiles function due to a lack of proper validation of user-supplied paths prior to file operations.

item.title: ZDI-25-656: Samsung MagicINFO 9 Server getZipFileListForImport Unrestricted File Upload Remote Code Execution Vulnerability
item.description: Vulnerable Product: Samsung MagicINFO 9 Server; CVE(s): CVE-2025-54439; Summary: This vulnerability allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code on affected installations of Samsung MagicINFO 9 Server by uploading arbitrary files without proper validation. Although authentication is required, the existing mechanism can be bypassed.

item.title: ZDI-25-657: Samsung MagicINFO 9 Server MagicInfoWebAuthorClient Unrestricted File Upload Remote Code Execution Vulnerability
item.description: Vulnerable Product: Samsung MagicINFO 9 Server; CVE(s): CVE-2025-54440; Summary: This vulnerability allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code on affected installations of Samsung MagicINFO 9 Server without authentication. The flaw exists within the MagicInfoWebAuthorClient app due to a lack of proper validation of user-supplied data, allowing the upload of arbitrary files and execution in the context of SYSTEM.

item.title: ShinyHunters May Have Teamed Up With Scattered Spider in Salesforce Attack Campaigns
item.description: ShinyHunters, a financially motivated threat group, has launched sophisticated attacks targeting Salesforce instances across high-profile enterprises in various industries. The attacks involve ticket-themed phishing domains and credential-harvesting pages, as well as vishing campaigns and data exfiltration via Mullvad VPN obfuscation. Circumstantial evidence suggests a potential alliance between ShinyHunters and Scattered Spider.

item.title: ZDI-25-658: Samsung MagicINFO 9 Server getFontFileFromMagicInfoServer Unrestricted File Upload Remote Code Execution Vulnerability
item.description: Vulnerable Product: Samsung MagicINFO 9 Server; CVE(s): CVE-2025-54441; Summary: This vulnerability allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code on affected installations of Samsung MagicINFO 9 Server, with authentication bypassable. The flaw exists within the getFontFileFromMagicInfoServer method due to lack of proper validation of user-supplied data, allowing upload of arbitrary files.

item.title: ZDI-25-659: Samsung MagicINFO 9 Server SWUpdateFileUploadServlet Directory Traversal Remote Code Execution Vulnerability
item.description: Vulnerable Product: Samsung MagicINFO 9 Server; CVE(s): CVE-2025-54443; Summary: This vulnerability allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code on affected installations of Samsung MagicINFO 9 Server without authentication. The flaw exists in the SWUpdateFileUploadServlet class due to lack of proper validation of a user-supplied path prior to using it in file operations.

item.title: ZDI-25-660: Samsung MagicINFO 9 Server filenameHasExecutableType Unrestricted File Upload Remote Code Execution Vulnerability
item.description: Vulnerable Product: Samsung, MagicINFO 9 Server; CVE(s): CVE-2025-54444; Summary: The vulnerability allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code on affected installations of Samsung MagicINFO 9 Server without authentication. It exists in the implementation of the filenameHasExecutableType method due to a lack of proper validation of user-supplied data, which can allow the upload of arbitrary files.

item.title: ZDI-25-661: Samsung MagicINFO 9 Server parseXMLString XML External Entity Processing Information Disclosure Vulnerability
item.description: Vulnerable Product: Samsung MagicINFO 9 Server; CVE(s): CVE-2025-54445; Summary: This vulnerability allows remote attackers to disclose sensitive information on affected installations of Samsung MagicINFO 9 Server without authentication. It exists in the implementation of the parseXMLString method due to improper XML External Entity (XXE) reference restrictions, allowing an attacker to embed contents back into the XML document for further processing and disclosing SYSTEM-level information.

item.title: ZDI-25-662: Samsung MagicINFO 9 Server ResponseUploadActivity Directory Traversal Remote Code Execution Vulnerability
item.description: Vulnerable Product: Samsung MagicINFO 9 Server; CVE(s): CVE-2025-54446; Summary: This vulnerability allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code on affected installations of the Samsung MagicINFO 9 Server without authentication. The issue is caused by a lack of proper validation of user-supplied paths prior to using them in file operations, which can be exploited to execute code in the context of SYSTEM.

item.title: ZDI-25-663: Samsung MagicINFO 9 Server OpenApiController Unrestricted File Upload Remote Code Execution Vulnerability
item.description: Vulnerable Product: Samsung MagicINFO 9 Server; CVE(s): CVE-2025-54447; Summary: This vulnerability allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code on affected installations of Samsung MagicINFO 9 Server without authentication. The specific flaw exists within the OpenApiController class due to lack of proper validation of user-supplied data, allowing upload of arbitrary files and execution of code in the context of SYSTEM.

item.title: ZDI-25-664: Samsung MagicINFO 9 Server copyResourceToFile Unrestricted File Upload Remote Code Execution Vulnerability
item.description: Vulnerable Product: Samsung MagicINFO 9 Server; CVE(s): CVE-2025-54448; Summary: This vulnerability allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code on affected installations of Samsung MagicINFO 9 Server without authentication. The flaw exists in the copyResourceToFile method due to lack of proper validation of user-supplied data, allowing uploads of arbitrary files.

item.title: ZDI-25-665: Samsung MagicINFO 9 Server fillLftOrLfdInfo Unrestricted File Upload Remote Code Execution Vulnerability
item.description: Vulnerable Product: Samsung MagicINFO 9 Server; CVE(s): CVE-2025-54449, ZDI-CAN-25873, ZDI-25-665; Summary: This vulnerability allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code on affected installations of Samsung MagicINFO 9 Server without authentication. The issue is due to the lack of proper validation of user-supplied data, which can allow the upload of arbitrary files.

item.title: ZDI-25-666: Samsung MagicINFO 9 Server DeviceLogUploadServlet Directory Traversal Remote Code Execution Vulnerability
item.description: Vulnerable Product: Samsung MagicINFO 9 Server; CVE(s): CVE-2025-54450; Summary: This vulnerability allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code on affected installations of Samsung MagicINFO 9 Server. Authentication is required to exploit this vulnerability, and an attacker can leverage this vulnerability to execute code in the context of SYSTEM.

item.title: ZDI-25-667: Samsung MagicINFO 9 Server MagicInfoCache Deserialization of Untrusted Data Remote Code Execution Vulnerability
item.description: Vulnerable Product: Samsung MagicINFO 9 Server; CVE(s): CVE-2025-54451; Summary: This vulnerability allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code on affected installations of Samsung MagicINFO 9 Server without authentication. The issue exists within the RMI service due to a lack of proper validation of user-supplied data, leading to deserialization of untrusted data.

item.title: ZDI-25-668: Samsung MagicINFO 9 Server ServletAuthenticationProcessingFilter Authentication Bypass Vulnerability
item.description: Vulnerable Product: Samsung MagicINFO 9 Server; CVE(s): CVE-2025-54452; Summary: This vulnerability allows remote attackers to partially bypass authentication on affected installations of Samsung MagicINFO 9 Server, without requiring authentication. The issue exists within the ServletAuthenticationProcessingFilter class due to an improper implementation of the authentication algorithm.

item.title: ZDI-25-669: Samsung MagicINFO 9 Server FtpMetaUploadServlet Directory Traversal Remote Code Execution Vulnerability
item.description: Vulnerable Product: Samsung MagicINFO 9 Server; CVE(s): CVE-2025-54453; Summary: This vulnerability allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code on affected installations of Samsung MagicINFO 9 Server by bypassing authentication and exploiting a lack of proper validation of user-supplied paths in the FtpMetaUploadServlet class.

item.title: ZDI-25-670: Samsung MagicINFO 9 Server PremiumClientService Hard-coded Cryptographic Key Authentication Bypass Vulnerability
item.description: Vulnerable Product: Samsung, MagicINFO 9 Server; CVE(s): CVE-2025-54454; Summary: This vulnerability allows remote attackers to bypass authentication on affected installations of Samsung MagicINFO 9 Server. Authentication is not required to exploit this vulnerability. The specific flaw exists within the PremiumClientService class due to a hard-coded cryptographic key, which can be leveraged to bypass system authentication.

item.title: ZDI-25-671: Samsung MagicINFO 9 Server PremiumClientService Hard-coded Cryptographic Key Authentication Bypass Vulnerability
item.description: Vulnerable Product: Samsung MagicINFO 9 Server; CVE(s): CVE-2025-54455; Summary: This vulnerability allows remote attackers to bypass authentication on affected installations of Samsung MagicINFO 9 Server, with no authentication required to exploit it. The flaw exists within the PremiumClientService class due to a hard-coded cryptographic key, which can be leveraged by an attacker to bypass system authentication.

item.title: ZDI-25-672: Samsung MagicINFO 9 Server filenameHasExecutableType Unrestricted File Upload Remote Code Execution Vulnerability
item.description: Vulnerable Product: Samsung MagicINFO 9 Server; CVE(s): CVE-2025-54442; Summary: This vulnerability allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code on affected installations of Samsung MagicINFO 9 Server without authentication. The issue exists within the implementation of the filenameHasExecutableType method and can be exploited by uploading arbitrary files due to lack of proper validation of user-supplied data.

item.title: ZDI-25-673: Apple Safari getHourCycles Stack-based Buffer Overflow Remote Code Execution Vulnerability
item.description: Vulnerable Product: Apple Safari; CVE(s): CVE-2025-43209; Summary: This vulnerability allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code on affected installations of Apple Safari. User interaction is required to exploit this vulnerability, as the target must visit a malicious page or open a malicious file. The issue results from the lack of proper validation of the length of user-supplied data prior to copying it to a fixed-length stack-based buffer.

item.title: ZDI-25-674: Apple macOS AppleIntelKBLGraphics Out-Of-Bounds Read Information Disclosure Vulnerability
item.description: Vulnerable Product: Apple macOS; CVE(s): CVE-2025-43255; Summary: The vulnerability allows local attackers to disclose sensitive information on affected installations of Apple macOS. An attacker must obtain the ability to execute low-privileged code to exploit this vulnerability, which exists within the AppleIntelKBLGraphics kext due to lack of proper validation of user-supplied data.

item.title: ZDI-25-675: Apple macOS USD readAccessorInts Out-Of-Bounds Read Information Disclosure Vulnerability

item.title: Microsoft removes PowerShell 2.0 from Windows 11, Windows Server
item.description: Microsoft will permanently remove PowerShell 2.0 from Windows 11 version 24H2, starting in August, and from Windows Server 2025 in September. The move aims to reduce system complexity and improve security by removing legacy code.

item.title: Zoom and Xerox Release Critical Security Updates Fixing Privilege Escalation and RCE Flaws
item.description:
Vulnerable Product: Zoom; CVE(s): CVE-2025-49457; Summary: The vulnerability in Zoom Clients for Windows allows an unauthenticated user to conduct privilege escalation via network access, with a CVSS score of 9.6. Affected products include Zoom Workplace, Zoom Workplace VDI, Zoom Rooms, and Zoom Meeting SDK, all before version 6.3.10.
Vulnerable Product: Xerox; CVE(s): CVE-2025-8355, CVE-2025-8356; Summary: The vulnerabilities in Xerox FreeFlow Core include an XML External Entity (XXE) injection vulnerability leading to server-side request forgery (SSRF), and a path traversal vulnerability leading to remote code execution. Both issues have been addressed in version 8.0.4, with CVSS scores of 7.5 and 9.8, respectively.

item.description: Vulnerable Product: Kenwood DMX958XR; CVE(s): CVE-2025-8647; Summary: The Kenwood DMX958XR firmware update process contains a command injection vulnerability that allows physically present attackers to execute arbitrary code on affected devices without authentication. The issue results from the lack of proper validation of version information before performing an update, allowing an attacker to execute arbitrary code in the context of root.

item.title: ZDI-25-805: (0Day) Vacron Camera ping Command Injection Remote Code Execution Vulnerability
item.description: Vulnerable Product: Vacron Camera; CVE(s): CVE-2025-8613; Summary: This vulnerability allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code on affected installations of Vacron Camera devices. Authentication is required to exploit this vulnerability, which exists within the webs.cgi endpoint due to a lack of proper validation of user-supplied strings before executing system calls. An attacker can leverage this vulnerability to execute code in the context of root.

item.title: ZDI-25-806: (0Day) AOMEI Backupper Workstation Link Following Local Privilege Escalation Vulnerability
item.description: Vulnerable Product: AOMEI; Backupper Workstation; CVE(s): CVE-2025-8612; Summary: This vulnerability allows local attackers to escalate privileges on affected installations of AOMEI Backupper Workstation by creating a junction and abusing the restore functionality. An attacker must obtain low-privileged code execution and user interaction from an administrator to exploit this vulnerability, which can be used to execute arbitrary code in the context of SYSTEM.
